questions.text: If A is a 3×2 matrix and B is a 2×4 matrix, what is the order of AB?
questions.explanation:
A(3×2) × B(2×4) = AB(3×4)
Outer dimensions give the result: 3 rows, 4 columns

Transpose interchanges rows and columns.
Row matrix (1×3) becomes column matrix (3×1)

For diagonal matrix, determinant = product of diagonal elements
= 2 × 5 = 10

questions.text: If |A| = 5 and A is a 3×3 matrix, find |2A|.
questions.explanation:
|kA| = kⁿ|A| where n is the order
|2A| = 2³ × 5 = 8 × 5 = 40

questions.text: The identity matrix of order 2 is:
questions.explanation:
Identity matrix has 1s on diagonal and 0s elsewhere:
I₂ = [1  0]
     [0  1]

questions.text:
If A = [1  2] and B = [5], find AB.
       [3  4]         [6]

questions.explanation:
|A| = 2×6 - 3×4 = 12 - 12 = 0
Second row is multiple of first row (proportional), so determinant is 0

A is identity matrix
I² = I × I = I
= [1  0]
  [0  1]

questions.text: The determinant of identity matrix I₃ is:
questions.explanation:
Determinant of identity matrix of any order is always 1
|I| = 1
